The men's lacrosse side continued their winning start to the season with a 5-3 win over the University of Manchester seconds (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

The men's hockey firsts carried on their impressive resurgence in form with their third win on the trot as they defeated Durham fourths 2-0 (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

The cult of the manager

Sean Cole explores English football's obsession with its football managers (Thumbnail credit Image: AtilaTheHun via Flickr Creative Commons)

The rise of the Welsh

Tom Shipman investigates the success of Cardiff and Swansea in this year's Championship and asks whether next season will see a Welsh side in the Premier League. (Thumbnail credit Image: Watt_Dabney via Flickr Creative Commons)

York Futsallers edged out in Premier League debut

York's Futsallers were unlucky to narrowly lose both games in their first BUCS matchday of the season. (Thumbnail credit Ben Smith, pictured in action last year, was one of York's Futsallers in action today. Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

James sail past Derwent in College Rugby grudge match

James comfortably overcame Derwent 40-0 in College Rugby's grudge match at York RI on Sunday afternoon. (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

"Title winning performance" for Goodricke as they defeat Halifax

Sam Lewis's Goodricke side continued their 100% record with a 3-1 win over Tom Ragan's Halifax side. (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Goals galore as Vanbrugh hammer Langwith

A hat-trick from Ali Prince helped Vanbrugh put five past Langwith on a busy morning of College Football. (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Derwent prove far too strong for Alcuin

Derwent carried on their recent good form with a 4-0 win over Alcuin this morning. (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Big hit for Crusaders as they go into administration

Ben Barron investigates the impact of Welsh Rugby League side Crusaders entering administration. (Thumbnail credit Ryan O'Hara is captain of the stricken Welsh side. Image: paddynapper via Flickr Creative Commons)

Haye v Harrison in the Battle of Britain: A preview

Saturday night sees WBA World Heavyweight Champion David Haye take on Olympic Gold medalist Audley Harrison in the so-called Battle of Britain, Bradley Wood previews the action. (Thumbnail credit Image: AtilaTheHun via Flickr Creative Commons)

Women's footballers unlucky in Hallam defeat

The women's football team were unlucky to be on the wrong side of a 2-1 scoreline on Wednesday. (Thumbnail credit Image: Charlie Woods)

Football thirds narrowly lose out to Teesside

The football thirds travelled to Teesside on Wednesday, but were unable to gain their first win of the season, going down 2-1. (Thumbnail credit James Wilson, pictured here representing Vanbrugh in College Football, was the thirds' Man of the Match and kept out a penalty. Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Will Amir Khan get a chance to fight Floyd Mayweather?

With many people's interest in Boxing drawn towards tomorrow's Heavyweight battle between David Haye and Audley Harrison, Graham Lilley discusses the possibility of Amir Khan coming up against Floyd Mayweather, Jr. (Thumbnail credit Image: Chamber Of Fear via Flickr Creative Commons)

Table tennis secure close BUCS win

York clinched a close 9-8 win over Durham seconds in BUCS Table Tennis on Wednesday. (Thumbnail credit Image: Aaste Haukvik Traen)

Wales Rally GB provides tough test for final World Rally Championship event

The final round of the World Rally Championships gets underway in Wales tonight, Sam Morgan provides an insight into the thrills and spills that can be expected. (Thumbnail credit Image: Alexeisol via Flickr Creative Commons)

Men's basketball players seal first win of the season

The men's first basketballers secured their first win of the season with a comfortable 56-38 win over Newcastle University seconds today. (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

York's women confidently defeat Newcastle

York's women's basketball players cemented their place at the top of the 3B Northern Conference League with a 46-16 win over Newcastle University seconds. (Thumbnail credit Image: Peter Iveson)

Great win for women's firsts as new system pays dividends

The women's hockey romped to a 4-1 win over Newcastle University thirds on the JLD earlier today. (Thumbnail credit Image: Charlie Woods)

The success of the underdog is revitalising the Premier League

Christopher Underwood argues that the success of Newcastle, Blackpool and West Brom is livening up the Premier League (Thumbnail credit Image: AtilaTheHun via Flickr Creative Commons)

Monday Night Lights: Ambrozejczyk on American sport

Introducing to you the first of Nouse Sport's now daily comment and analysis pieces, David Ambrozejczyk's view of all things from sport across the pond. (Thumbnail credit Image: Maitri via Flickr Creative Commons)

Derwent carry on good form with impressive win

Derwent continued their momentum with an impressive 3-0 win against Wentworth, despite captain Matt Hallam suffering a broken nose. (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Vanbrugh hammer five past Halifax

Halifax were on the receiving end of a thrashing as Vanbrugh sealed a 5-1 win on the 22 Acres this morning. (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Goodricke come from behind to win 2-1

Goodricke have won every one of their games this season and continued that trend with a 2-1 win over James this morning (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Alcuin enjoy 3-1 victory over Langwith

Alcuin overcame Langwith 3-1 in a tough and physical battle on matchday three of the College Cup. (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)

Nouse's guide to the Autumn Internationals

Joseph Cormack delivers the ultimate guide to the Autumn internationals, previewing the six sides playing this weekend as well as which individuals to look out for. (Thumbnail credit Martin Johnson will be hoping England's win over Australia this summer heralds a new beginning for his side. Image: David Spender via Flickr Creative Commons)

Nouse Sports Podcast

By James Bithell

The new edition of the Nouse Sports Podcast is here. All things York are discussed as well as the goings-on outside the walls of this great city. Get involved, listen and comment. (Thumbnail credit Image: Justyn Hardcastle)
